body:
as discussed in #599 @pablogamboa suggested allowing a custom JSON encoder / decoder library.

This would allow libraries like orjson to be used without making them explicit dependencies of pydantic.

The problem here is going to be how to deal with the `default` argument with standard lib `json` and `orjson` allow, but not `ujson`.
If this requires a breaking change it should be done with the bump to version 1.
Did you think about implementing something similar to @JrooTJunior done in https://github.com/aiogram/aiogram/blob/dev-2.x/aiogram/utils/json.py?

I would prefer more like the [`json_serialize`](https://docs.aiohttp.org/en/stable/client_quickstart.html#json-request) argument in aiohttp, so the end user is responsible for implementing a function that correct encodes or decodes JSON.

Yes. `json_serialize` is more good way.

I want to remove this code from aiogram.
> https://github.com/aiogram/aiogram/blob/dev-2.x/aiogram/utils/json.py

issue.title: switch from ujson to orjson

labels.name: change
labels.description: Suggested alteration to Pydantic, not a new feature nor a bug

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
I got an email some time ago from @ijl:

> removed (I was asked to remove the content of the email)

(I asked if they could create an issue but I guess it got forgotten)

If we want to move to orjson (and it sounds to me like a pretty good idea) it should be done before v1.

I guess we should make `orjson` a requirement and use it always rather than switch between ujson and json.

Any feedback on this?

I guess it would allow us to simplify `pydantic_encoder` eg. by no longer having to deal with datetime objects.

However there would also be some breaking changes I think.

@tiangolo do you have any view on this? I know you have a significant requirement for serialising to JSON but also to "JSON-like python objects". Does orjson help or hinder this?

body: No one has started this. PR very welcome.

issue.title: Orjson feature. Orjson give very good perfomance for example in FASTAPI 2 codes

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
Orjson give very good perfomance for example in FASTAPI 2 codes
This with orjson
![image](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/assets/11828278/8e7da8c9-32d5-45cc-8136-886ab9b11d73)
![image](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/assets/11828278/c66683f4-6c6a-489f-a337-23392d0ac5bd)

And this without
![image](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/assets/11828278/888d2c63-2ef6-4ac2-be53-f16ebcdc4df9)
![image](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/assets/11828278/2b8241a9-56f2-4541-9dab-97a98c737376)
810 vs 583 resuests/second
892 vs 643 MB  per 10seconds
~20% speedup
So... how use orjson inside pydantic?
Because if we use this 
![image](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/assets/11828278/600b5e48-a60b-40da-adfd-0d721d57099d)
![image](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/assets/11828278/c64ba844-6acc-43e2-9ae6-d7027a0eec9f)

I think pydantic use slowly serelize by default...
P.S.
tools for testing _autocannon 127.0.0.1:81 -d 10 -c 30 -w 3_
start fastapi uvicorn 1 worker

_Originally posted by @shurshilov in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/discussions/6388#discussioncomment-7211179_
